articles.author: James Wagner
articles.title: Blue Jays Cleared for Return to Canada
articles.description: The team has been granted an exception to resume play in Toronto on July 30, with restrictions in place to help prevent coronavirus outbreaks.
articles.content: The last time the Blue Jays played a game at Rogers Centre, their stadium in downtown Toronto, was Sept. 29, 2019. Since then, because the coronavirus pandemic led to the closing of the Canadian bord… [+855 chars]

articles.author: James Wagner
articles.title: Softball Is Back in the Olympics, and So Are 10 Veterans of 2008
articles.description: Softball was dropped from the Olympic program after the 2008 Beijing Games. Now the sport, and 10 veterans of that tournament, is back.
articles.content: Regula retired after the Beijing Olympics because she had gotten married the year before, wanted to start her family (beginning in 2009, she had three children in three years) and soon owned a gym wi… [+1456 chars]

articles.author: Ken Belson
articles.title: America’s Rugby Sevens Teams Try to Restart Their Prepandemic Roll
articles.description: The U.S. teams were ranked second in the world in 2019 and eager for a medal in Tokyo. Then the pandemic stopped them in their tracks.
articles.content:
The pandemic throws momentum out the window, said Rupert Cox, a rugby commentator for NBC Sports. The key issue are the players who are battling back from injury.
Because of travel restrictions, the… [+859 chars]

articles.author: Ben Rothenberg
articles.title: Wimbledon, and British Tennis Fans, See a Rising Star in Emma Raducanu
articles.description: The teenager, a wild-card entry, delighted and surprised in the tournament’s first week. She is part of a growing trend of young women who are showing that experience isn’t everything.
articles.content: Raducanu cited two of her favorite players as Li Na and Simona Halep those two two-time major champions represent the countries of Raducanus origin. Her father, Ian, is Romanian, and her mother, Rene… [+896 chars]

articles.author: Shivani Gonzalez
articles.title: What’s on TV This Week: The N.B.A. Draft and Cesar Millan
articles.description: The N.B.A. hosts its 75th draft and Cesar Millan returns to TV with a new show focused on rescue dogs and their owners.
articles.content: CESAR MILLAN: BETTER HUMAN BETTER DOG 9 p.m. on the National Geographic Channel. The dog trainer Cesar Millan is back on the small screen this week with his new show, Better Human Better Dog. Millan … [+1507 chars]
